etymologies: mid 16th century (as a mystical word used as a charm to ward off illness): from Latin (4th century AD), of uncertain origin

definitions: a word said by magicians when performing a magic trick.
shortDefinitions: word said by conjurors when performing magic trick

definitions: language, typically in the form of gibberish, used to give the impression of arcane knowledge or power

examples.text: I get so fed up with all the mumbo jumbo and abracadabra

shortDefinitions: language used to give impression of arcane knowledge

definitions: the implausibly easy achievement of difficult feats

examples.text: a computer and a little abracadabra turn a freeze-dried steak into a romantic dinner

shortDefinitions: implausibly easy performance of difficult feats
